abstract: Citigroup is looking for potential partners in its bid for Wachovia, seeking to wrest the upper hand from Wachovia’s other suitor Wells Fargo , The Wall Street Journal said, citing people familiar with the matter.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup is looking for potential partners in its bid for Wachovia, seeking to wrest the upper hand from Wachovia’s other suitor Wells Fargo , The Wall Street Journal said, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Citigroup Said to Seek Partners for Wachovia Bid

abstract: The two banks said that they had agreed to extend their legal standstill in the fight for Wachovia until Friday morning.
snippet: The two banks said that they had agreed to extend their legal standstill in the fight for Wachovia until Friday morning.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup and Wells Fargo, the two banks vying for control of the Wachovia Corporation, are negotiating a compromise that would hand the bulk of the troubled bank to Wells Fargo, according to people close to the situation.

headline.main: Citigroup and Wells Fargo Are Nearing a Compromise Over Control of Wachovia
headline.print_headline: Citigroup and Wells Fargo Are Nearing a Compromise Over Control of Wachovia

abstract: Citigroup, Wells Fargo and Wachovia have extended their cease-fire through Friday morning. Although things are still murky, it appears that Wells Fargo will get the bulk of Wachovia’s operations, with Citi obtaining a face-saving helping of Wachovia’s depository institutions. According to DealBook, the parties are still negotiating over who buys Wachovia’s Mid-Atlantic and Southeast depository banks. Whatever the outcome of this negotiation and even if litigation ensues, the main lessons from this dispute have already been learned. Here are the main ones I see:

Although things are still murky, it appears that Wells Fargo will get the bulk of Wachovia’s operations, with Citi obtaining a face-saving helping of Wachovia’s depository institutions. According to DealBook, the parties are still negotiating over who buys Wachovia’s Mid-Atlantic and Southeast depository banks. headline.main: Half-Time Lessons From the Battle for Wachovia
